configuration.description: Enables use of global fields query parameter to filter response to only specified fields. This will override any existing vendor functionality on the connector

configuration.description: Zoho Crm V2 Max Page Size (or limit)

configuration.description: Zoho Crm V2 OAuth Refresh Interval (s)

configuration.description: Zoho Crm V2 Event Notification Signature Key

configuration.name: Default select fields
configuration.description: Generic map used to specify default fields for bulk download and GET /all requests. Each key should be the canonical objectName and values may be specified as a comma-delimited string or a list of strings

configuration.name: Event Type
configuration.description: Zoho Crm V2 Event Type

configuration.name: Event poller refresh interval
configuration.description: Zoho Crm V2 Set time interval for polling application (in minutes)

configuration.name: Event Notifications Enabled
configuration.description: Zoho Crm V2 Enable/Disable Event Notification

configuration.description: Zoho Crm V2 Event Notification Callback URL

configuration.name: Event Notification UserName

configuration.name: Event Notification Password
configuration.description: Event Notification basic authentication password

configuration.name: Event Poller Resources Configuration
configuration.description: Event Poller Resources Configuration. If the "event.poller.urls" configuration is defined, this field's value is ignored. The configuration is defined via JSON, an example of which is as follows - {     "contacts": {         "url": "/hubs/helpdesk/contacts",         "updatedDateField": "user.updated_at",         "updatedDateFormat": "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssX",         "pageSize": 10000     } }

description: Add a Zoho CRM V2 Instance to connect your existing Zoho CRM account to the CRM Hub, allowing you to manage contacts, leads, accounts, opportunities etc. across multiple CRM Elements. You will need your Zoho CRM account information to add an instance.

resources.description: Update the lead note associated with the given ID in the CRM system

Find tasks in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all tasks which contain the word test, the search expression parameter will be where=word='test', If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all tasks whose payload contains the word 'discussion', the search expression parameter will be where=word='discussion'. To search for tasks where Subject starts with 'max', the query will be where=Subject='max%'. The supported join is 'and'and the operator supported is '='

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

resources.description: Create a new task in the CRM system. task creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'task' model are those required to create a new task

$se_module.x-conditionally-required-description: Required if What_Id field is specified

Update the task associated with the given ID in the CRM system

resources.description: Find users in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all users which contain the word test, the search expression parameter will be where=word='test', If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of users. Values can be 'AllUsers', 'ActiveUsers', 'DeactiveUsers', 'ConfirmedUsers', 'NotConfirmedUsers', 'DeletedUsers', 'ActiveConfirmedUsers', 'AdminUsers', 'ActiveConfirmedAdmins', 'CurrentUser'

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, Modified_Time='2019-01-24T17:48:27+05:30'. The supported join is 'and' and the operator supported is '='

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied.

parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied

resources.description: Find activities_events in the CRM system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all activities_events whose Subject is the word 'discussion', the search expression parameter will be where=Subject='discussion'. To search for an activities_event where the Subject starts with the word 'discussion' the search query whould be where=Subject like '%discussion' If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned \n

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all activities-events whose payload contains the word 'discussion', the search expression parameter will be where=word='discussion'. To search for activities-events where Event_Title starts with 'max', the query will be where=Event_Title='max%'. The supported join is 'and'and the operator supported is '='

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The start page for pagination, which defaults to 1 if not supplied

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied
